text:
We are using Batik for rendering svg diagrams inside of Eclipse.  We have tried 
Eclipse 3.0 and 3.1 with Batik 1.5 and 1.6.  I have scaled down the problem to 
using only JSVGCanvas and the AWT/SWT bridge in it's simplest form.  As svg 
diagrams are loaded with the JSVGCanvas new memory is allocated on the heap.  
This memory is seldom returned and cleaned up.  After between 5 and 20 minutes 
of reloading svg graphics Eclipse gives a heap out of memory error.  I have 
tried increasing the heap size and it still crashes eventually.  Please contact 
me for the plugin code.  I am using Redhat Enterprise 3 update 3 Linux.  Thanks.
James
creator: james_stoddard@agilent.com

text:
(In reply to comment #0)
> Please contact me for the plugin code.

Are you able to attach a simple test case showing the symptom? Given the huge time span, I'd say Java/Eclipse/Batik might already have fixed related issues (but, then again, I'm just guessing)...

At a minimum, please state whether this is still happening using a more updated environment.
